concept.title: Links in PDFs
concept.shortdesc: In print, many of the links you see in XHTML output don't show up. This is because the links come from the same hierarchy that is used to generate the PDF, and so the links would be redundant.

conbody.p: For example, next and previous links are unnecessary when topics are on adjacent pages; and links between parents and children become nothing more than links from the start of a chapter to each of its sections, and from each section back to the chapter start.
To get links in PDFs, you can use relationship tables, which describe non-hierarchical relationships.
